action.action-desc: Mrs. Comstock introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To prohibit deductions for settlements subject to nondisclosure agreements paid in connection with sexual harassment or sexual abuse, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Stop Tax Subsidies for Sexual Abusers and Harassers Act of 2017.

section.header: Denial of deduction for settlements subject to nondisclosure agreements paid in connection with sexual harassment or sexual abuse

subsection.text: Section 162 is amended by redesignating subsection (q) as subsection (r) and by inserting after subsection (p) the following new subsection:

subsection.header: Payments related to sexual harassment and sexual abuse
subsection.text: No deduction shall be allowed under this chapter for any settlement or payment related to sexual harassment or sexual abuse if such settlement or payment is subject to a nondisclosure agreement or attorneyâ€™s fees related to such a settlement or payment.
The amendments made by this section shall apply with respect to amounts paid or incurred after the date of the enactment of this Act.
